Question
========
In a science quiz, 10 Utrecht and 10 Amsterdam students compete against each other. The Utrecht students score 7 points more than the Amsterdam students, and the pooled variance of the scores equals 45. Do the scores of the Utrecht and Amsterdam students differ significantly from each other in a 2-sided test with $\alpha$ = 5%? 
Answerlist
----------
* No, because the test statistic is 1.04 and the critical limits are ± 2.101.
* No, because the test statistic is 1.04 and the critical limits are ± 2.262.
* Yes, because the test statistic is 2.33 and the critical limits are ± 2.101.
* Yes, because the test statistic is 2.33 and the critical limits are ± 2.262.
